file_content.text: I can't--I don't want to talk about it. I just need to think for a while.
You did it! I can't decide if I'm ashamed that I couldn't do it or happy that my mission is complete.
There was supposed to be something important behind the boulder!
It would appear we were mistaken.
Guess not.
Then we should continue the search.
Maybe it's just not apparent.
Pretty unsatisfying....
But....
I'm very disappointed, Flingeld.
Master Quilljayk, why are you here?
The valuable materials beyond that boulder were enlightenment and perseverance--and you failed to acquire them.
You've become unbalanced by doubt and self-recrimination. By enlisting another's aid to complete this trial, you have confirmed deep-rooted weakness.
I'm afraid your training must come to an end. You will not become a Jedi.
But Master, it's not my fault. I didn't ask for help. I--I tried to decline!
That is simply not true, Master Quilljayk.
He's lying.
I sense the calm in you, young one. It speaks to your veracity.
I know how important becoming a Jedi was to you and your family, Flingeld. Unfortunately, I have no choice.
You will be stationed in the archives here and serve the order in a clerical capacity. It is decided.
You--it's all your fault. You ruined my chances.
Flingeld was never expected to move that boulder. Communing with the Force is something only a Master typically has the clarity to achieve.
That's right, Master. I imposed myself on Flingeld's mission.
Yes, I volunteered.
Then perhaps you should have minded your own business.
All right, Flingeld. You should have known better than to accept help, but I am compelled to give you one last chance.
Thank you, Master. Your patience and faith in me are a compliment.
It's not faith, it's thoroughness. Now, stand aside while I address your fellow.
Flingeld was never expected to move that boulder, Padawan. Communing with the Force in such a way is something only a Master typically has the clarity to achieve.
What was he supposed to do? Did you deliberately set him up to fail?
What was being tested?
Not at all.
So, you were testing his determination and resolve.
He had to face frustration.
Yes. And his inner fortitude proved inflexible, so he crumbled.
So, in truth, you forced him to fight himself.
He was to wrestle with doubt.
That's correct. How very perceptive of you.
I had the clarity to commune with the Force. What do you think of that?
And yet, I succeeded.
Quite an accomplishment--and highly unexpected.
Flingeld's task was to learn to persevere despite futility. When one's self-image depends on success, shortcuts are taken.
It's imperative that we screen out Padawans unable to assume the great responsibility of the Jedi. You've done the order an important service.
I'm proud to have helped.
I did nothing noteworthy. Just what was called for.
I only did my duty.
Humility is the benchmark of the Jedi.
I feel sorry for Flingeld. He tried very hard.
It's too bad he failed.
There's no place for pity in the life of a Jedi. You must endeavor to get over it.
Flingeld? You may return to the temple when you are ready.
Yes. Yes, Master.
You have our thanks. Now may the Force be with you.
Your well-intentioned interference has spoiled this trial. Now, my pursuit of Flingeld's worthiness to be Jedi must take a new tack.
Flingeld might surprise you the next time around.
He deserves a second chance.
Rest assured, Flingeld's training has been and will continue to be exhaustive and thorough.
My mistake.
Do not be concerned, Padawan, you are here to learn.
Maybe next time his trials should make sense.
Give him a better test.
Although you demonstrate the clarity of a Master, you have a lot to learn about being Jedi.
Flingeld, return to my chambers in the temple. Prepare yourself for your next test.
Right away, Master.
Stay focused on your own training, Padawan. May the Force be with you.
You're back? Whoa, there's some kind of aura emanating from you. Quick! Before it wears off, see if you can move the boulder!
Let me know if you get around to meditating at the altar.
Argh, it's impossible! Why would my Master assign me a trial that can't be done?
Do you need help?
What are you carrying on about?
Why the hysterics?
Quiet, idiot, every beast in the ruins will converge on you.
Control yourself.
Oh! You startled me. I didn't see you approach.
My Master says there are valuable materials behind that boulder over there. But get this--the blasted thing can't be moved.
My instructions were to go to a platform in the ruins. "Meditate, and let the Force empower me." But I've meditated 'til I can't see straight--and nothing.
Maybe you should just try again.
Keep at it.
You have no idea how long I've been at this.
You admit defeat? You're just going to give up?
You're quitting, then?
What else am I supposed to do?
That's rather pathetic for a Padawan, isn't it?
What use are you?
I did everything I could!
So, I'm gonna get drummed out of the order because I can't move a rock that can't be moved? It's absurd.
Hey, what if--maybe you could help me. Are you good at this meditation thing?
I don't know, but I'm game to try.
Let's find out.
Of course.
Tell me why I should help you with your training.
It's your mission, not mine.
Isn't the Jedi Order about cooperation and fellowship? Giving assistance to a fellow in need is our duty, right?
I heartily agree. What do I have to do?
Good point.
Oh, thank you! You're a lifesaver.
Enough already. You've guilted me into doing it.
Fine.
I'll take what I can get.
So, just kneel at the altar nearby. Supposedly, if you find deep inner peace, you'll be able to move the boulder.
If you fail, I can tell my Master it wasn't just me who couldn't move it.
Be right back.
Take your time. At this point, I'm set.
I see you've got it all figured out.
Covering yourself, huh?
Hey, someone like me has to look for back doors once in a while.
Sounds like you expect me to fail. Don't count on it.
You lack faith.
Hey, no offense. All the better if you actually pull it off.
Just go to the platform, meditate at the altar, move the boulder--that's all I'm asking. I'll be waiting for you back here. Good luck.
Not interested. [Refuse quest]
It figures. Well, if you change your mind, I'm sure I'll still be here.
I have to concentrate. Please leave me to my trials.
